gst.data

Class BufferedValueController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gst.data.DataController
      • gst.data.ValueController
        • gst.data.BufferedValueController

  • public class BufferedValueController
extends ValueController
    Buffered version of a ValueController which supports reading and writing of data. Only double-type data and one single channel are supported.
    Version:
    0.0.1.0 (12.10.2012)
    Author:
    Enrico Grunitz

    • Method Detail

      • addDataPoint

        public void addDataPoint(double time,
                double value,
                boolean notify)
        Inserts a new data point into the buffer and may notify registered DataChangeListeners.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        value - value of the data point
        notify - if true all DataChangeListeners are notified

      • addDataPoint

        public void addDataPoint(double time,
                double value)
        Inserts a new data point into the buffer and notifies the listeners. Convenience method to always notify listeners.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        value - value of the data point

      • modifyDataPoint

        public boolean modifyDataPoint(double time,
                      double oldValue,
                      double newValue,
                      boolean notify)
        Changes the value of the data point with the time time and its value oldValue to newValue.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        oldValue - value of the data point
        newValue - new value for the data point
        notify - if true all registered DataChangeListeners are notified about data change
        Returns:
        true if modify was success else false

      • modifyDataPoint

        public boolean modifyDataPoint(double time,
                      double oldValue,
                      double newValue)
        Convenience method for modifyDataPoint(time, oldValue, newValue, notify = true).
        Changes the value of the data point with the time time and its value oldValue to newValue. All registered DataChangeListeners are notified about data change.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        oldValue - value of the data point
        newValue - new value for the data point
        Returns:
        true if modify was success else false

      • clearDataPoints

        public void clearDataPoints()
        Removes all data-points from the controller. Seriously there will be no confirmation dialog, no "Are you sure? Yes. No. Maybe."-questioning. So be absolutely, uber extremely sure you don't need the data anymore. And never ever say I didn't warn you about this behavior.

      • removeDataPoint

        public boolean removeDataPoint(double time,
                      double value,
                      boolean notify)
        Removes the data point of the given time and value from the buffer. If removal is successful true is returned, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        value - value of the data point
        notify - if true all registered DataChangeListeners are notified of data removal
        Returns:
        true if removal was successful

      • removeDataPoint

        public boolean removeDataPoint(double time,
                      double value)
        Convenience method for removeDataPoint(double, double, boolean) with notification set to true.
        Removes the data point of the given time and value from the buffer. If removal is successful true is returned, otherwise false. All register DataChangeListeners are notified upon data removal.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time of the data point
        value - value of the data point
        Returns:
        true if removal was successful

      • removeDataAt

        public int removeDataAt(double time,
               boolean notify)
        Removes all data at the given point in time from the buffer. The number of removed elements is returned. If notify is true all registered gst.data.DataChangeListener are notified of the changed data.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time to remove all data points from
        notify - if true all DataChangeListeners are notified of changed data
        Returns:
        number of removed data points

      • removeDataAt

        public int removeDataAt(double time)
        Convenience method for removeDataAt(double time, boolean notify = true).
        Removes all data at the given point in time from the buffer. The number of removed elements is returned. All registered gst.data.DataChangeListener are notified of the changed data.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time to remove all data points from
        Returns:
        number of removed data points

      • getDataPoints

        public org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries getDataPoints(double startTime,
                                       double endTime,
                                       int maxPoints)
        Description copied from class: DataController
        Returns the data points as an XYSeries. All data points are between startTime and endTime.
        Overrides:
        getDataPoints in class ValueController
        Parameters:
        startTime - beginning time
        endTime - ending time
        maxPoints - number of maximum data points
        Returns:
        the array of data points or null if there are only annotations
        See Also:
        ValueController.getDataPoints(double, double, int)

      • saveImpl

        public void saveImpl()
        Description copied from class: DataController

        Overrides:

        See Also:

      • insert

        private void insert(BufferedValueController.DataPoint<java.lang.Double> dp)
        Inserts the given BufferedValueController.DataPoint into the buffer below the element that has a higher samplestamp than the given point. Also updates the lastAccessedIndex accordingly.
        Parameters:
        dp - the DataPoint to insert

      • initAndFillBuffer

        private void initAndFillBuffer()
        Reads all data from file and fills the buffer. Notifies Listeners at the end.

      • seekLower

        private int seekLower(long sampleStamp)
        Searches for the index of the buffer-element which sample-stamp is lower than the given sample-stamp. Starting search from lastAccessedIndex.
        Parameters:
        sampleStamp -
        Returns:
        index of the element which sample-stamp is the highest below the given, -1 if there is no lower sample-stamp

      • seek

        private int seek(long sampleStamp)
        Seeks the first element in the buffer, that has the given sample-stamp.
        Parameters:
        sampleStamp - the sample-stamp to look for
        Returns:
        index of the first element with the given sample-stamp or -1 if there is no such element in the buffer

      • seek

        private int seek(BufferedValueController.DataPoint<java.lang.Double> dp)
        Searches the buffer for a BufferedValueController.DataPoint which equals the given.
        Parameters:
        dp - the DataPoint to look for
        Returns:
        the index of the first matching DataPoint or -1 if there is no such point

      • seekHigher

        private int seekHigher(long sampleStamp)
        Returns the index of the buffer-element which has the lowest sample-stamp above the given.
        Parameters:
        sampleStamp - the sample-stamp to seek for
        Returns:
        index of the element with the smallest sampleStamp above the given, buffer.size() if there is no bigger element

      • updateLastAccess

        private void updateLastAccess(int index)
        Updates lastAccessedIndex to the given value, but checks size of the buffer. If index is lower 0 it is set to 0. If it is higher or equal buffer.size() it is set to buffer.size() - 1. If buffer.size() is 0 it is also set to 0.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to set to

      • valueArrayFromBuffer

        private org.unisens.Value[] valueArrayFromBuffer()
        Creates a new array of org.unisens.Value from data-points in the buffer.
        Returns:
        array of Values of the buffers data
